creator: jacob@keystreams.com
text:
Not sure if this is a bug or a feature but...
In httpd.conf I changed the path to the httpd.pid file. When the server starts 
the file is created and everything works. When I attempt to restart or stop 
the server it errors out saying "httpd (no pid file) not running". This causes 
a problem mostly on restart since another instance of Apache springs up. I 
edited the apachectl file to point to the same file as in httpd.conf and the 
server now stops and restarts properly. It seems unlikely that this 
configuration setting should need to be changed in 2 places.

Apache 2.0 was changed to pick up the pid file setting from the configuration
file.  In Apache 1.3 you need to edit apachectl to point to the right pid
file.
